The yield on the 10-year Treasury note -- the benchmark for U.S. interest rates -- was up this morning following Friday's somewhat positive jobs report. Julia Coronado, chief economist for North America at BNP Paribas, joins Marketplace Morning Report host David Brancaccio to discuss.

title: Which would you rather have: More jobs or lower interest rates?
teaser: The yield on the 10-year Treasury note -- the benchmark for U.S. interest rates -- was up this morning following Friday's somewhat positive jobs report.
contentencoded: The yield on the 10-year Treasury note -- the benchmark for U.S. interest rates -- was up this morning following Friday's somewhat positive jobs report. Julia Coronado, chief economist for North America at BNP Paribas, joins Marketplace Morning Report host David Brancaccio to discuss.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Monday, July 8, 2013
description: The yield on the 10-year Treasury note -- the benchmark for U.S. interest rates -- was up this morning following Friday's somewhat positive jobs report.
